task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 272°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building facade and roofline to estimate total height, so I should tilt the camera upward while staying on the current heading.
The view is now facing north instead of west, so I should rotate left to re-align with the target building direction (~272°).
To estimate height I need the roofline and ground reference in the same view, so I should look up slightly while staying centered on the west-facing building.
The camera again ended up facing north; I must rotate left to return to the west-facing building to make the height estimate.
I likely need to provide the estimate now based on the main building in front; a typical 3-story institutional building is about 12–15 m tall, so I'll report ~14 m.
